description: Promotes a read replica DB cluster to a standalone DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBCluster
nested_items.description: Contains the details of an Amazon Aurora DB cluster or Multi-AZ DB cluster.

nested_items.name: AllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: AllocatedStorage specifies the allocated storage size in gibibytes (GiB). For Aurora, AllocatedStorage can vary because Aurora DB cluster storage size adjusts as needed.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZones
nested_items.description: The list of Availability Zones (AZs) where instances in the DB cluster can be created.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days for which automatic DB snapshots are retained.

nested_items.name: CharacterSetName
nested_items.description: If present, specifies the name of the character set that this cluster is associated with.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of the initial database that was specified for the DB cluster when it was created, if one was provided. This same name is returned for the life of the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: The user-supplied identifier for the DB cluster. This identifier is the unique key that identifies a DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBClusterParameterGroup
nested_items.description: The name of the DB cluster parameter group for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroup
nested_items.description: Information about the subnet group associated with the DB cluster, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current state of this DB cluster.

nested_items.name: AutomaticRestartTime
nested_items.description: The time when a stopped DB cluster is restarted automatically.

nested_items.name: PercentProgress
nested_items.description: The progress of the operation as a percentage.

nested_items.name: EarliestRestorableTime
nested_items.description: The earliest time to which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.

nested_items.name: Endpoint
nested_items.description: The connection endpoint for the primary instance of the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: ReaderEndpoint
nested_items.description: The reader endpoint for the DB cluster. The reader endpoint for a DB cluster load-balances connections across the Aurora Replicas that are available in a DB cluster. As clients request new connections to the reader endpoint, Aurora distributes the connection requests among the Aurora Replicas in the DB cluster. This functionality can help balance your read workload across multiple Aurora Replicas in your DB cluster.

nested_items.name: CustomEndpoints
nested_items.description: The custom endpoints associated with the DB cluster.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MultiAZ
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB cluster has instances in multiple Availability Zones.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: The database engine used for this DB cluster.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the database engine.

nested_items.name: LatestRestorableTime
nested_items.description: The latest time to which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port that the database engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: MasterUsername
nested_items.description: The master username for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBClusterOptionGroupMemberships
nested_items.description: The list of option group memberships for this DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBClusterOptionGroupName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the DB cluster option group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Specifies the status of the DB cluster option group.

nested_items.name: PreferredBackupWindow
nested_items.description: The daily time range during which automated backups are created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the BackupRetentionPeriod.

nested_items.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
nested_items.description: The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: ReplicationSourceIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier of the source DB cluster if this DB cluster is a read replica.

nested_items.name: ReadReplicaIdentifiers
nested_items.description: Contains one or more identifiers of the read replicas associated with this DB cluster.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StatusInfos
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: StatusType
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: Normal
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: DBClusterMembers
nested_items.description: The list of DB instances that make up the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: Specifies the instance identifier for this member of the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: IsClusterWriter
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the cluster member is the primary DB instance for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBClusterParameterGroupStatus
nested_items.description: Specifies the status of the DB cluster parameter group for this member of the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: PromotionTier
nested_items.description: A value that specifies the order in which an Aurora Replica is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing primary instance. For more information, see Fault Tolerance for an Aurora DB Cluster in the Amazon Aurora User Guide.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: The list of VPC security groups that the DB cluster belongs to.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroupId
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The membership status of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: HostedZoneId
nested_items.description: The ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted zone.

nested_items.name: StorageEncrypted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB cluster is encrypted.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: If StorageEncrypted is enabled, the Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier for the encrypted DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DbClusterResourceId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region-unique, immutable identifier for the DB cluster. This identifier is found in Amazon Web Services CloudTrail log entries whenever the KMS key for the DB cluster is accessed.

nested_items.name: DBClusterArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: AssociatedRoles
nested_items.description: A list of the Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that are associated with the DB cluster. IAM roles that are associated with a DB cluster grant permission for the DB cluster to access other Amazon Web Services on your behalf.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that is associated with the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Describes the state of association between the IAM role and the DB cluster. The Status property returns one of the following values:
ACTIVE - the IAM role ARN is associated with the DB cluster and can be used to access other Amazon Web Services on your behalf.
PENDING - the IAM role ARN is being associated with the DB cluster.
INVALID - the IAM role ARN is associated with the DB cluster, but the DB cluster is unable to assume the IAM role in order to access other Amazon Web Services on your behalf.

nested_items.name: FeatureName
nested_items.description: The name of the feature associated with the Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) role. For information about supported feature names, see  DBEngineVersion.

nested_items.name: IAMDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the mapping of Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts to database accounts is enabled.

nested_items.name: CloneGroupId
nested_items.description: The ID of the clone group with which the DB cluster is associated. For newly created clusters, the ID is typically null.

nested_items.name: ClusterCreateTime
nested_items.description: The time when the DB cluster was created, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: EarliestBacktrackTime
nested_items.description: The earliest time to which a DB cluster can be backtracked.

nested_items.name: BacktrackWindow
nested_items.description: The target backtrack window, in seconds. If this value is set to 0, backtracking is disabled for the DB cluster. Otherwise, backtracking is enabled.

nested_items.name: BacktrackConsumedChangeRecords
nested_items.description: The number of change records stored for Backtrack.

nested_items.name: EnabledCloudwatchLogsExports
nested_items.description: A list of log types that this DB cluster is configured to export to CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Capacity
nested_items.description: The current capacity of an Aurora Serverless v1 DB cluster. The capacity is 0 (zero) when the cluster is paused.

nested_items.name: EngineMode
nested_items.description: The DB engine mode of the DB cluster, either provisioned or serverless.

nested_items.name: ScalingConfigurationInfo
nested_items.description: The scaling configuration for an Aurora DB cluster in serverless DB engine mode.

nested_items.name: MinCapacity
nested_items.description: The minimum capacity for an Aurora DB cluster in serverless DB engine mode.

nested_items.name: MaxCapacity
nested_items.description: The maximum capacity for an Aurora DB cluster in serverless DB engine mode.

nested_items.name: AutoPause
nested_items.description: Indicates whether automatic pause is allowed for the Aurora DB cluster in serverless DB engine mode.

nested_items.name: SecondsUntilAutoPause
nested_items.description: The remaining amount of time, in seconds, before the Aurora DB cluster in serverless mode is paused. A DB cluster can be paused only when it's idle (it has no connections).

nested_items.name: TimeoutAction
nested_items.description: The action that occurs when Aurora times out while attempting to change the capacity of an Aurora Serverless v1 cluster. The value is either ForceApplyCapacityChange or RollbackCapacityChange.

nested_items.name: SecondsBeforeTimeout
nested_items.description: The number of seconds before scaling times out. What happens when an attempted scaling action times out is determined by the TimeoutAction setting.

nested_items.name: RdsCustomClusterConfiguration
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: InterconnectSubnetId
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: TransitGatewayMulticastDomainId
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: ReplicaMode
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: DeletionProtection
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB cluster has deletion protection enabled. The database can't be deleted when deletion protection is enabled.

nested_items.name: HttpEndpointEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the HTTP endpoint is enabled for an Aurora DB cluster.

nested_items.name: ActivityStreamMode
nested_items.description: The mode of the database activity stream. Database events such as a change or access generate an activity stream event. The database session can handle these events either synchronously or asynchronously.

nested_items.name: ActivityStreamStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: ActivityStreamKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier used for encrypting messages in the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: ActivityStreamKinesisStreamName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Kinesis data stream used for the database activity stream.

nested_items.name: CopyTagsToSnapshot
nested_items.description: Indicates whether tags are copied from the DB cluster to snapshots of the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: CrossAccountClone
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB cluster is a clone of a DB cluster owned by a different Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: DomainMemberships
nested_items.description: The Active Directory Domain membership records associated with the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: Domain
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Active Directory Domain.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the Active Directory Domain membership for the DB instance or cluster. Values include joined, pending-join, failed, and so on.

nested_items.name: FQDN
nested_items.description: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Active Directory Domain.

nested_items.name: IAMRoleName
nested_items.description: The name of the IAM role used when making API calls to the Directory Service.

nested_items.name: OU
nested_items.description: The Active Directory organizational unit for the DB instance or cluster.

nested_items.name: AuthSecretArn
nested_items.description: The ARN for the Secrets Manager secret with the credentials for the user that's a member of the domain.

nested_items.name: DnsIps
nested_items.description: The IPv4 DNS IP addresses of the primary and secondary Active Directory domain controllers.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TagList
nested_items.description: A list of tags.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_items.name: GlobalClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: Contains a user-supplied global database cluster identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies a global database cluster.

nested_items.name: GlobalWriteForwardingStatus
nested_items.description: The status of write forwarding for a secondary cluster in an Aurora global database.

nested_items.name: GlobalWriteForwardingRequested
nested_items.description: Indicates whether write forwarding is enabled for a secondary cluster in an Aurora global database. Because write forwarding takes time to enable, check the value of GlobalWriteForwardingStatus to confirm that the request has completed before using the write forwarding feature for this cluster.

nested_items.name: PendingModifiedValues
nested_items.description: Information about pending changes to the DB cluster. This information is returned only when there are pending changes. Specific changes are identified by subelements.

nested_items.name: PendingCloudwatchLogsExports
nested_items.description: A list of the log types whose configuration is still pending. In other words, these log types are in the process of being activated or deactivated.

nested_items.name: LogTypesToEnable
nested_items.description: Log types that are in the process of being deactivated. After they are deactivated, these log types aren't exported to CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LogTypesToDisable
nested_items.description: Log types that are in the process of being enabled. After they are enabled, these log types are exported to CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DBClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: The DBClusterIdentifier value for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: MasterUserPassword
nested_items.description: The master credentials for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: IAMDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether mapping of Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts to database accounts is enabled.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The database engine version.

nested_items.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days for which automatic DB snapshots are retained.

nested_items.name: AllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: The allocated storage size in gibibytes (GiB) for all database engines except Amazon Aurora. For Aurora, AllocatedStorage always returns 1, because Aurora DB cluster storage size isn't fixed, but instead automatically adjusts as needed.

nested_items.name: RdsCustomClusterConfiguration
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: InterconnectSubnetId
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: TransitGatewayMulticastDomainId
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: ReplicaMode
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The Provisioned IOPS (I/O operations per second) value. This setting is only for non-Aurora Multi-AZ DB clusters.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: The storage type for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: CertificateDetails
nested_items.description: The details of the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: CAIdentifier
nested_items.description: The CA identifier of the CA certificate used for the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: ValidTill
nested_items.description: The expiration date of the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: DBClusterInstanceClass
nested_items.description: The name of the compute and memory capacity class of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: The storage type associated with the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The Provisioned IOPS (I/O operations per second) value.

nested_items.name: PubliclyAccessible
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB cluster is publicly accessible.

nested_items.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
nested_items.description: Indicates whether minor version patches are applied automatically.

nested_items.name: MonitoringInterval
nested_items.description: The interval, in seconds, between points when Enhanced Monitoring metrics are collected for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: MonitoringRoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN for the IAM role that permits RDS to send Enhanced Monitoring metrics to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: DatabaseInsightsMode
nested_items.description: The mode of Database Insights that is enabled for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: PerformanceInsightsEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Performance Insights is enabled for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: PerformanceInsightsKMSKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier for encryption of Performance Insights data.

nested_items.name: PerformanceInsightsRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days to retain Performance Insights data.
month * 31, where month is a number of months from 1-23. Examples: 93 (3 months * 31), 341 (11 months * 31), 589 (19 months * 31)

nested_items.name: ServerlessV2ScalingConfiguration
nested_items.description: The scaling configuration for an Aurora Serverless v2 DB cluster.

nested_items.name: MinCapacity
nested_items.description: The minimum number of Aurora capacity units (ACUs) for a DB instance in an Aurora Serverless v2 cluster. You can specify ACU values in half-step increments, such as 8, 8.5, 9, and so on. For Aurora versions that support the Aurora Serverless v2 auto-pause feature, the smallest value that you can use is 0. For versions that don't support Aurora Serverless v2 auto-pause, the smallest value that you can use is 0.5.

nested_items.name: MaxCapacity
nested_items.description: The maximum number of Aurora capacity units (ACUs) for a DB instance in an Aurora Serverless v2 cluster. You can specify ACU values in half-step increments, such as 32, 32.5, 33, and so on. The largest value that you can use is 256 for recent Aurora versions, or 128 for older versions.

nested_items.name: SecondsUntilAutoPause
nested_items.description: The number of seconds an Aurora Serverless v2 DB instance must be idle before Aurora attempts to automatically pause it. This property is only shown when the minimum capacity for the cluster is set to 0 ACUs. Changing the minimum capacity to a nonzero value removes this property. If you later change the minimum capacity back to 0 ACUs, this property is reset to its default value unless you specify it again.

nested_items.name: NetworkType
nested_items.description: The network type of the DB instance.

nested_items.name: DBSystemId
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: MasterUserSecret
nested_items.description: The secret managed by RDS in Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager for the master user password.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the secret.

nested_items.name: SecretStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the secret.
creating - The secret is being created.
active - The secret is available for normal use and rotation.
rotating - The secret is being rotated.

impaired - The secret can be used to access database credentials, but it can't be rotated. A secret might have this status if, for example, permissions are changed so that RDS can no longer access either the secret or the KMS key for the secret. When a secret has this status, you can correct the condition that caused the status. Alternatively, modify the DB instance to turn off automatic management of database credentials, and then modify the DB instance again to turn on automatic management of database credentials.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the secret.

nested_items.name: IOOptimizedNextAllowedModificationTime
nested_items.description: The next time you can modify the DB cluster to use the aurora-iopt1 storage type.

nested_items.name: LocalWriteForwardingStatus
nested_items.description: Indicates whether an Aurora DB cluster has in-cluster write forwarding enabled, not enabled, requested, or is in the process of enabling it.

nested_items.name: AwsBackupRecoveryPointArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recovery point in Amazon Web Services Backup.

nested_items.name: LimitlessDatabase
nested_items.description: The details for Aurora Limitless Database.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of Aurora Limitless Database.

nested_items.name: MinRequiredACU
nested_items.description: The minimum required capacity for Aurora Limitless Database in Aurora capacity units (ACUs).

nested_items.name: StorageThroughput
nested_items.description: The storage throughput for the DB cluster. The throughput is automatically set based on the IOPS that you provision, and is not configurable.

nested_items.name: ClusterScalabilityType
nested_items.description: The scalability mode of the Aurora DB cluster. When set to limitless, the cluster operates as an Aurora Limitless Database. When set to standard (the default), the cluster uses normal DB instance creation.

nested_items.name: CertificateDetails
nested_items.description: The details of the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: CAIdentifier
nested_items.description: The CA identifier of the CA certificate used for the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: ValidTill
nested_items.description: The expiration date of the DB instance's server certificate.

nested_items.name: EngineLifecycleSupport
nested_items.description: The lifecycle type for the DB cluster.
